channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report I-2024110034
item.description:
Report I-2024110034

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-20T12:31:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-04
  • City: Long Island City
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/04/2024 hidden dangerous goods were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the DHL Express LIC facility, located at 12-12 33rd Avenue, Long Island City, NY 11106. Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains UN3480 Lithium ion batteries Class 9 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Case Material of Construction: Plastic Package Capacity: 134 g Amount in Package: 134 g Number in Shipment: 2 Number Failed: 2

item.title: Report E-2024110267
item.description:
Report E-2024110267

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-13
  • City: ROCHESTER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XRC experienced a UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide Monohydrate release from a 50-pound poly bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of product released to a 4’ x 3’ area of the concrete dock floor. The bag was ripped as a result of improper loading. The damaged bag and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into a 15-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024110321
item.description:
Report E-2024110321

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: CASTLETON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight material handler discovered 2 boxes that were slightly wet. Apparently there was freight loaded on top of them and as a result the extra weight on top crushed the boxes causing a internal can in each box to slightly leaked from the lids that popped as a result from the top freight contributing to the unintentional release. The spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container.

item.title: Report E-2024110316
item.description:
Report E-2024110316

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-29
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Material handler discovered a pail slightly leaking while doing a dock check. Further investigation discovered that it appeared that the pail was struck by another piece of freight during temporary storage consequently puncturing it and contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.

item.title: Report E-2024100510
item.description:
Report E-2024100510

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: Jamaica
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: LUFTHANSA CARGO AKTIENGESELLSCHAFT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While doing a warehouse inventory, cargo agent noticed a DGR pc of cargo looked wet. He contacted a supervisor for further Investigation. This pe was on top of a skid containing additional pcs of the awb. Upon removing this po from the top of the skid it was noticed that it was toxic. The area was roped off and the import file was obtained, the 24 hour emergency contact number (Chemtrek) was called. Agent fowarded the Safety Data Sheet. We were told to follow rule 6 and 7 which allowed us to place the fiberboard box into a salvage container using protective equipment. The box itself was not noticably leaking but did appear wet. Absorbant material was first placed into the container, then the box, then more abosorbant material.

item.title: Report X-2024110406
item.description:
Report X-2024110406

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: JAMAICA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Nov 5th during the PM sort at the JFK ramp, a fibreboard gaylord was discovered that was torn at the button, visible through the tear are loose laptops. After reviewing the paperwork that states there are 500 laptops inside the package, the shipment was stopped and is being held pending an investigation by the FAA.
